member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.QueryAccounts(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve all accounts
member.remarks:
This API is for use by Avalara Registrar administrative users only. Get multiple account objects. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter. Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters. You may specify one or more of the following values in the '$include' parameter to fetch additional nested data, using commas to separate multiple values:
Subscriptions
Users For more information about filtering in REST, please see the documentation at http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ .
member.param: A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.
A filter statement to identify specific records to retrieve, as defined by https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/master/Guidelines.md#97-filtering .
If nonzero, return no more than this number of results.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.GetUserEntitlements(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve all entitlements for a single user
member.remarks:
Return a list of all entitlements to which this user has rights to access. Entitlements are a list of specified API calls the user is permitted to make, a list of identifier numbers for companies the user is allowed to use, and an access level identifier that indicates what types of access roles the user is allowed to use. This API call is intended to provide a validation endpoint to determine, before making an API call, whether this call is likely to succeed. For example, if user 567 within account 999 is attempting to create a new child company underneath company 12345, you could preview the user's entitlements and predict whether this call would succeed:
Retrieve entitlements by calling '/api/v2/accounts/999/users/567/entitlements' . If the call fails, you do not have accurate credentials for this user.
If the 'accessLevel' field within entitlements is 'None', the call will fail.
If the 'accessLevel' field within entitlements is 'SingleCompany' or 'SingleAccount', the call will fail if the companies table does not contain the ID number 12345.
If the 'permissions' array within entitlements does not contain 'AccountSvc.CompanySave', the call will fail. For a full list of defined permissions, please use '/api/v2/definitions/permissions' .
member.param: The ID of the user to retrieve.
The accountID of the user you wish to get.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.AccountResetLicenseKey(System.Int32,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.ResetLicenseKeyModel)
member.summary: Reset this account's license key
member.remarks: Resets the existing license key for this account to a new key. To reset your account, you must specify the ID of the account you wish to reset and confirm the action. Resetting a license key cannot be undone. Any previous license keys will immediately cease to work when a new key is created.
member.param: The ID of the account you wish to update.
A request confirming that you wish to reset the license key of this account.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ResolveAddress(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Retrieve geolocation information for a specified address
member.remarks: Resolve an address against Avalara's address-validation system. If the address can be resolved, this API provides the latitude and longitude of the resolved location. The value 'resolutionQuality' can be used to identify how closely this address can be located. If the address cannot be clearly located, use the 'messages' structure to learn more about problems with this address. This is the same API as the POST /api/v2/addresses/resolve endpoint. Both verbs are supported to provide for flexible implementation.
member.param: Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
City
State / Province / Region
Postal Code / Zip Code
Two character ISO 3166 Country Code (see /api/v2/definitions/countries for a full list)
Geospatial latitude measurement
Geospatial longitude measurement

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ResolveAddressPost(Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AddressInfo)
member.summary: Retrieve geolocation information for a specified address
member.remarks: Resolve an address against Avalara's address-validation system. If the address can be resolved, this API provides the latitude and longitude of the resolved location. The value 'resolutionQuality' can be used to identify how closely this address can be located. If the address cannot be clearly located, use the 'messages' structure to learn more about problems with this address. This is the same API as the GET /api/v2/addresses/resolve endpoint. Both verbs are supported to provide for flexible implementation.
member.param: The address to resolve

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.QueryBatches(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve all batches
member.remarks: Get multiple batch objects across all companies. A batch object is a large collection of API calls stored in a compact file. When you create a batch, it is added to the AvaTax Batch Queue and will be processed in the order it was received. You may fetch a batch to check on its status and retrieve the results of the batch operation. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.
member.param: A filter statement to identify specific records to retrieve, as defined by https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/master/Guidelines.md#97-filtering .
A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.
If nonzero, return no more than this number of results.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ListTransactionsByCompany(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve all transactions
member.remarks:
List all transactions attached to this company. This endpoint is limited to returning 1,000 transactions at a time maximum. A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds). Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters. You may specify one or more of the following values in the '$include' parameter to fetch additional nested data, using commas to separate multiple values:
Lines
Details (implies lines)
Summary (implies details)
Addresses
member.param: The company code of the company that recorded this transaction
A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.
A filter statement to identify specific records to retrieve, as defined by https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/master/Guidelines.md#97-filtering .
If nonzero, return no more than this number of results.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.

member.summary: Retrieve a single transaction by code
member.remarks:
Get the current transaction identified by this URL. If this transaction was adjusted, the return value of this API will be the current transaction with this code, and previous revisions of the transaction will be attached to the 'history' data field. You may specify one or more of the following values in the '$include' parameter to fetch additional nested data, using commas to separate multiple values:
Lines
Details (implies lines)
Summary (implies details)
Addresses

The transaction code to retrieve

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.AdjustTransaction(System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AdjustTransactionModel)
member.summary: Correct a previously created transaction
member.remarks: Replaces the current transaction uniquely identified by this URL with a new transaction. A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds). When you adjust a committed transaction, the original transaction will be updated with the status code 'Adjusted', and both revisions will be available for retrieval based on their code and ID numbers. Only transactions in 'Committed' status are reported by Avalara Managed Returns. Transactions that have been previously reported to a tax authority by Avalara Managed Returns are no longer available for adjustments.
member.param: The company code of the company that recorded this transaction
The transaction code to adjust
The adjustment you wish to make

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ChangeTransactionCode(System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.ChangeTransactionCodeModel)
member.summary: Change a transaction's code
member.remarks: Renames a transaction uniquely identified by this URL by changing its code to a new code. After this API call succeeds, the transaction will have a new URL matching its new code. A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds).
member.param: The company code of the company that recorded this transaction
The transaction code to change
The code change request you wish to execute

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CommitTransaction(System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CommitTransactionModel)
member.summary: Commit a transaction for reporting
member.remarks: Marks a transaction by changing its status to 'Committed'. Transactions that are committed are available to be reported to a tax authority by Avalara Managed Returns. A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds). Any changes made to a committed transaction will generate a transaction history.
member.param: The company code of the company that recorded this transaction
The transaction code to commit
The commit request you wish to execute

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateReturnAdjustment(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.FilingAdjustmentModel})
member.summary: Add an adjustment to a given filing.
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. An "Adjustment" is usually an increase or decrease to customer funding to Avalara, such as early filer discount amounts that are refunded to the customer, or efile fees from websites. Sometimes may be a manual change in tax liability similar to an augmentation. This API creates a new adjustment for an existing tax filing. This API can only be used when the filing has not yet been approved.
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filing being adjusted.
The year of the filing's filing period being adjusted.
The month of the filing's filing period being adjusted.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country of the filing being adjusted.
The two or three character region code for the region.
The unique code of the form being adjusted.
A list of Adjustments to be created for the specified filing.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateReturnAugmentation(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.FilingAugmentationModel})
member.summary: Add an augmentation for a given filing.
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. An "Augmentation" is a manually added increase or decrease in tax liability, by either customer or Avalara usually due to customer wanting to report tax Avatax does not support, e.g. bad debts, rental tax. This API creates a new augmentation for an existing tax filing. This API can only be used when the filing has not been approved.
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filing being changed.
The month of the filing's filing period being changed.
The month of the filing's filing period being changed.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country of the filing being changed.
The two or three character region code for the region of the filing being changed.
The unique code of the form being changed.
A list of augmentations to be created for the specified filing.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ApproveFilingsCountryRegion(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.ApproveFilingsModel)
member.summary: Approve all filings for the specified company in the given filing period, country and region.
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Approving a return means the customer is ready to let Avalara file that return. Customer either approves themselves from admin console, else system auto-approves the night before the filing cycle Sometimes Compliance has to manually unapprove and reapprove to modify liability or filing for the customer. A "filing period" is the year and month of the date of the latest customer transaction allowed to be reported on a filing, based on filing frequency of filing.
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filings.
The year of the filing period to approve.
The month of the filing period to approve.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country.
The two or three character region code for the region.
The approve request you wish to execute.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.RebuildFilingsByCountryRegion(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.RebuildFilingsModel)
member.summary: Rebuild a set of filings for the specified company in the given filing period, country and region.
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Rebuilding a return means re-creating or updating the amounts to be filed for a filing. Rebuilding has to be done whenever a customer adds transactions to a filing. A "filing period" is the year and month of the date of the latest customer transaction allowed to be reported on a filing, based on filing frequency of filing. This API requires filing to be unapproved.
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filings.
The year of the filing period to be rebuilt.
The month of the filing period to be rebuilt.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country.
The two or three character region code for the region.
The rebuild request you wish to execute.

member.summary: Retrieve locations for this company
member.remarks: List all location objects defined for this company. An 'Location' represents a physical address where a company does business. Many taxing authorities require that you define a list of all locations where your company does business. These locations may require additional custom configuration or tax registration with these authorities. For more information on metadata requirements, see the '/api/v2/definitions/locationquestions' API. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.
member.param: The ID of the company that owns these locations
A filter statement to identify specific records to retrieve, as defined by https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/master/Guidelines.md#97-filtering .
A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.
If nonzero, return no more than this number of results.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.BuildPointOfSaleDataForLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.PointOfSaleFileType},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Point of sale data file generation
member.remarks: Builds a point-of-sale data file containing tax rates and rules for this location, containing tax rates for all items defined for this company. This data file can be used to correctly calculate tax in the event a point-of-sale device is not able to reach AvaTax. This data file can be customized for specific partner devices and usage conditions. The result of this API is the file you requested in the format you requested using the 'responseType' field. This API builds the file on demand, and is limited to a maximum of 7500 items.
member.param: The ID number of the company that owns this location.
The ID number of the location to retrieve point-of-sale data.
The date for which point-of-sale data would be calculated (today by default)
The format of the file (JSON by default)
If specified, requests a custom partner-formatted version of the file.
When true, the file will include jurisdiction codes in the result.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ValidateLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Validate the location against local requirements
member.remarks: Returns validation information for this location. This API call is intended to compare this location against the currently known taxing authority rules and regulations, and provide information about what additional work is required to completely setup this location.
member.param: The ID of the company that owns this location
The primary key of this location

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ListNexusByCompany(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve nexus for this company
member.remarks: List all nexus objects defined for this company. The concept of 'Nexus' indicates a place where your company has sufficient physical presence and is obligated to collect and remit transaction-based taxes. When defining companies in AvaTax, you must declare nexus for your company in order to correctly calculate tax in all jurisdictions affected by your transactions. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateNexus(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.NexusModel})
member.summary: Create a new nexus
member.remarks: Creates one or more new nexus objects attached to this company. The concept of 'Nexus' indicates a place where your company has sufficient physical presence and is obligated to collect and remit transaction-based taxes. When defining companies in AvaTax, you must declare nexus for your company in order to correctly calculate tax in all jurisdictions affected by your transactions. Note that not all fields within a nexus can be updated; Avalara publishes a list of all defined nexus at the '/api/v2/definitions/nexus' endpoint. You may only define nexus matching the official list of declared nexus.
member.param: The ID of the company that owns this nexus.
The nexus you wish to create.

member.remarks: List all setting objects attached to this company. A 'setting' is a piece of user-defined data that can be attached to a company, and it provides you the ability to store information not defined or managed by Avalara. You may create, update, and delete your own settings objects as required, and there is no mandatory data format for the 'name' and 'value' data fields. To ensure correct operation of other programs or connectors, please create a new GUID for your application and use that value for the 'set' data field. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ListFundingRequestsByCompany(System.Int32)
member.summary: Check managed returns funding configuration for a company
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Requires a subscription to Avalara Managed Returns or SST Certified Service Provider. Returns a list of funding setup requests and their current status. Each object in the result is a request that was made to setup or adjust funding configuration for this company.
member.param: The unique identifier of the company

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateFundingRequest(System.Int32,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.FundingInitiateModel)
member.summary: Request managed returns funding setup for a company
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Companies that use the Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services are required to setup their funding configuration before Avalara can begin filing tax returns on their behalf. Funding configuration for each company is set up by submitting a funding setup request, which can be sent either via email or via an embedded HTML widget. When the funding configuration is submitted to Avalara, it will be reviewed by treasury team members before approval. This API records that an ambedded HTML funding setup widget was activated. This API requires a subscription to Avalara Managed Returns or SST Certified Service Provider.
member.param: The unique identifier of the company
The funding initialization request

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CompanyInitialize(Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyInitializationModel)
member.summary: Quick setup for a company with a single physical address
member.remarks:
Shortcut to quickly setup a single-physical-location company with critical information and activate it. This API provides quick and simple company setup functionality and does the following things:
Create a company object with its own tax profile
Add a key contact person for the company
Set up one physical location for the main office
Declare nexus in all taxing jurisdictions for that main office address
Activate the company This API only provides a limited subset of functionality compared to the 'Create Company' API call. If you need additional features or options not present in this 'Quick Setup' API call, please use the full 'Create Company' call instead.
member.param: Information about the company you wish to create.

member.remarks: Returns the full list of Avalara-supported entity use codes. Entity/Use Codes are definitions of the entity who is purchasing something, or the purpose for which the transaction is occurring. This information is generally used to determine taxability of the product. In order to facilitate correct reporting of your taxes, you are encouraged to select the proper entity use codes for all transactions that are exempt.

member.summary: Retrieve the list of questions that are required for a tax location
member.remarks: Returns the list of additional questions you must answer when declaring a location in certain taxing jurisdictions. Some tax jurisdictions require that you register or provide additional information to configure each physical place where your company does business. This information is not usually required in order to calculate tax correctly, but is almost always required to file your tax correctly. You can call this API call for any address and obtain information about what questions must be answered in order to properly file tax in that location.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.FundingRequestStatus(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve status about a funding setup request
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Companies that use the Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services are required to setup their funding configuration before Avalara can begin filing tax returns on their behalf. Funding configuration for each company is set up by submitting a funding setup request, which can be sent either via email or via an embedded HTML widget. When the funding configuration is submitted to Avalara, it will be reviewed by treasury team members before approval. This API checks the status on an existing funding request. This API requires a subscription to Avalara Managed Returns or SST Certified Service Provider.
member.param: The unique ID number of this funding request

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ActivateFundingRequest(System.Int64)
member.summary: Request the javascript for a funding setup widget
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Companies that use the Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services are required to setup their funding configuration before Avalara can begin filing tax returns on their behalf. Funding configuration for each company is set up by submitting a funding setup request, which can be sent either via email or via an embedded HTML widget. When the funding configuration is submitted to Avalara, it will be reviewed by treasury team members before approval. This API returns back the actual javascript code to insert into your application to render the JavaScript funding setup widget inline. Use the 'methodReturn.javaScript' return value to insert this widget into your HTML page. This API requires a subscription to Avalara Managed Returns or SST Certified Service Provider.
member.param: The unique ID number of this funding request

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.BuildPointOfSaleDataFile(Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.PointOfSaleDataRequestModel)
member.summary: Point of sale data file generation
member.remarks: Builds a point-of-sale data file containing tax rates and rules for items and locations that can be used to correctly calculate tax in the event a point-of-sale device is not able to reach AvaTax. This data file can be customized for specific partner devices and usage conditions. The result of this API is the file you requested in the format you requested using the 'responseType' field. This API builds the file on demand, and is limited to files with no more than 7500 scenarios.
member.param: Parameters about the desired file format and report format, specifying which company, locations and TaxCodes to include.

member.summary: Retrieve all settings
member.remarks: Get multiple setting objects across all companies. A 'setting' is a piece of user-defined data that can be attached to a company, and it provides you the ability to store information not defined or managed by Avalara. You may create, update, and delete your own settings objects as required, and there is no mandatory data format for the 'name' and 'value' data fields. To ensure correct operation of other programs or connectors, please create a new GUID for your application and use that value for the 'set' data field. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.

member.summary: Retrieve all tax rules
member.remarks: Get multiple taxrule objects across all companies. A tax rule represents a custom taxability rule for a product or service sold by your company. If you have obtained a custom tax ruling from an auditor that changes the behavior of certain goods or services within certain taxing jurisdictions, or you have obtained special tax concessions for certain dates or locations, you may wish to create a TaxRule object to override the AvaTax engine's default behavior in those circumstances. member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.GetUserEntitlementsAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve all entitlements for a single user;
member.remarks:
Return a list of all entitlements to which this user has rights to access. Entitlements are a list of specified API calls the user is permitted to make, a list of identifier numbers for companies the user is allowed to use, and an access level identifier that indicates what types of access roles the user is allowed to use. This API call is intended to provide a validation endpoint to determine, before making an API call, whether this call is likely to succeed. For example, if user 567 within account 999 is attempting to create a new child company underneath company 12345, you could preview the user's entitlements and predict whether this call would succeed:
Retrieve entitlements by calling '/api/v2/accounts/999/users/567/entitlements' . If the call fails, you do not have accurate credentials for this user.
If the 'accessLevel' field within entitlements is 'None', the call will fail.
If the 'accessLevel' field within entitlements is 'SingleCompany' or 'SingleAccount', the call will fail if the companies table does not contain the ID number 12345.
If the 'permissions' array within entitlements does not contain 'AccountSvc.CompanySave', the call will fail. For a full list of defined permissions, please use '/api/v2/definitions/permissions' .;
member.param: The ID of the user to retrieve.
The accountID of the user you wish to get.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ResolveAddressAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Retrieve geolocation information for a specified address;
member.remarks: Resolve an address against Avalara's address-validation system. If the address can be resolved, this API provides the latitude and longitude of the resolved location. The value 'resolutionQuality' can be used to identify how closely this address can be located. If the address cannot be clearly located, use the 'messages' structure to learn more about problems with this address. This is the same API as the POST /api/v2/addresses/resolve endpoint. Both verbs are supported to provide for flexible implementation.;
member.param: Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
City
State / Province / Region
Postal Code / Zip Code
Two character ISO 3166 Country Code (see /api/v2/definitions/countries for a full list)
Geospatial latitude measurement
Geospatial longitude measurement

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.AdjustTransactionAsync(System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AdjustTransactionModel)
member.summary: Correct a previously created transaction;
member.remarks: Replaces the current transaction uniquely identified by this URL with a new transaction. A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds). When you adjust a committed transaction, the original transaction will be updated with the status code 'Adjusted', and both revisions will be available for retrieval based on their code and ID numbers. Only transactions in 'Committed' status are reported by Avalara Managed Returns. Transactions that have been previously reported to a tax authority by Avalara Managed Returns are no longer available for adjustments.;
member.param: The company code of the company that recorded this transaction
The transaction code to adjust
The adjustment you wish to make

A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds).;

member.remarks: Replace the existing batch object at this URL with an updated object. A batch object is a large collection of API calls stored in a compact file. When you create a batch, it is added to the AvaTax Batch Queue and will be processed in the order it was received. You may fetch a batch to check on its status and retrieve the results of the batch operation. All data from the existing object will be replaced with data in the object you PUT. To set a field's value to null, you may either set its value to null or omit that field from the object you post.;
member.param: The ID of the company that this batch belongs to.
The ID of the batch you wish to update
The batch you wish to update.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.DeleteBatchAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Delete a single batch;
member.remarks: Mark the existing batch object at this URL as deleted.;
member.param: The ID of the company that owns this batch.
The ID of the batch you wish to delete.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateReturnAdjustmentAsync(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.FilingAdjustmentModel})
member.summary: Add an adjustment to a given filing.;
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. An "Adjustment" is usually an increase or decrease to customer funding to Avalara, such as early filer discount amounts that are refunded to the customer, or efile fees from websites. Sometimes may be a manual change in tax liability similar to an augmentation. This API creates a new adjustment for an existing tax filing. This API can only be used when the filing has not yet been approved.;
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filing being adjusted.
The year of the filing's filing period being adjusted.
The month of the filing's filing period being adjusted.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country of the filing being adjusted.
The two or three character region code for the region.
The unique code of the form being adjusted.
A list of Adjustments to be created for the specified filing.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateReturnAugmentationAsync(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.FilingAugmentationModel})
member.summary: Add an augmentation for a given filing.;
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. An "Augmentation" is a manually added increase or decrease in tax liability, by either customer or Avalara usually due to customer wanting to report tax Avatax does not support, e.g. bad debts, rental tax. This API creates a new augmentation for an existing tax filing. This API can only be used when the filing has not been approved.;
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filing being changed.
The month of the filing's filing period being changed.
The month of the filing's filing period being changed.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country of the filing being changed.
The two or three character region code for the region of the filing being changed.
The unique code of the form being changed.
A list of augmentations to be created for the specified filing.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ApproveFilingsCountryRegionAsync(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.ApproveFilingsModel)
member.summary: Approve all filings for the specified company in the given filing period, country and region.;
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Approving a return means the customer is ready to let Avalara file that return. Customer either approves themselves from admin console, else system auto-approves the night before the filing cycle Sometimes Compliance has to manually unapprove and reapprove to modify liability or filing for the customer. A "filing period" is the year and month of the date of the latest customer transaction allowed to be reported on a filing, based on filing frequency of filing.;
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filings.
The year of the filing period to approve.
The month of the filing period to approve.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country.
The two or three character region code for the region.
The approve request you wish to execute.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.RebuildFilingsByCountryRegionAsync(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Byte,System.String,System.String,Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.RebuildFilingsModel)
member.summary: Rebuild a set of filings for the specified company in the given filing period, country and region.;
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Rebuilding a return means re-creating or updating the amounts to be filed for a filing. Rebuilding has to be done whenever a customer adds transactions to a filing. A "filing period" is the year and month of the date of the latest customer transaction allowed to be reported on a filing, based on filing frequency of filing. This API requires filing to be unapproved.;
member.param: The ID of the company that owns the filings.
The year of the filing period to be rebuilt.
The month of the filing period to be rebuilt.
The two-character ISO-3166 code for the country.
The two or three character region code for the region.
The rebuild request you wish to execute.

member.summary: Retrieve locations for this company;
member.remarks: List all location objects defined for this company. An 'Location' represents a physical address where a company does business. Many taxing authorities require that you define a list of all locations where your company does business. These locations may require additional custom configuration or tax registration with these authorities. For more information on metadata requirements, see the '/api/v2/definitions/locationquestions' API. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.;
member.param: The ID of the company that owns these locations

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.BuildPointOfSaleDataForLocationAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.PointOfSaleFileType},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Point of sale data file generation;
member.remarks: Builds a point-of-sale data file containing tax rates and rules for this location, containing tax rates for all items defined for this company. This data file can be used to correctly calculate tax in the event a point-of-sale device is not able to reach AvaTax. This data file can be customized for specific partner devices and usage conditions. The result of this API is the file you requested in the format you requested using the 'responseType' field. This API builds the file on demand, and is limited to a maximum of 7500 items.;
member.param: The ID number of the company that owns this location.
The ID number of the location to retrieve point-of-sale data.
The date for which point-of-sale data would be calculated (today by default)
The format of the file (JSON by default)
If specified, requests a custom partner-formatted version of the file.
When true, the file will include jurisdiction codes in the result.

member.summary: Retrieve nexus for this company;
member.remarks: List all nexus objects defined for this company. The concept of 'Nexus' indicates a place where your company has sufficient physical presence and is obligated to collect and remit transaction-based taxes. When defining companies in AvaTax, you must declare nexus for your company in order to correctly calculate tax in all jurisdictions affected by your transactions. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.;

If nonzero, return no more than this number of results.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateNexusAsync(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.NexusModel})
member.summary: Create a new nexus;
member.remarks: Creates one or more new nexus objects attached to this company. The concept of 'Nexus' indicates a place where your company has sufficient physical presence and is obligated to collect and remit transaction-based taxes. When defining companies in AvaTax, you must declare nexus for your company in order to correctly calculate tax in all jurisdictions affected by your transactions. Note that not all fields within a nexus can be updated; Avalara publishes a list of all defined nexus at the '/api/v2/definitions/nexus' endpoint. You may only define nexus matching the official list of declared nexus.;
member.param: The ID of the company that owns this nexus.
The nexus you wish to create.

member.summary: Retrieve all settings for this company;
member.remarks: List all setting objects attached to this company. A 'setting' is a piece of user-defined data that can be attached to a company, and it provides you the ability to store information not defined or managed by Avalara. You may create, update, and delete your own settings objects as required, and there is no mandatory data format for the 'name' and 'value' data fields. To ensure correct operation of other programs or connectors, please create a new GUID for your application and use that value for the 'set' data field. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.;

member.summary: Request managed returns funding setup for a company;
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Companies that use the Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services are required to setup their funding configuration before Avalara can begin filing tax returns on their behalf. Funding configuration for each company is set up by submitting a funding setup request, which can be sent either via email or via an embedded HTML widget. When the funding configuration is submitted to Avalara, it will be reviewed by treasury team members before approval. This API records that an ambedded HTML funding setup widget was activated. This API requires a subscription to Avalara Managed Returns or SST Certified Service Provider.;
member.param: The unique identifier of the company
The funding initialization request

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CompanyInitializeAsync(Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyInitializationModel)
member.summary: Quick setup for a company with a single physical address;
member.remarks:
Shortcut to quickly setup a single-physical-location company with critical information and activate it. This API provides quick and simple company setup functionality and does the following things:
Create a company object with its own tax profile
Add a key contact person for the company
Set up one physical location for the main office
Declare nexus in all taxing jurisdictions for that main office address
Activate the company This API only provides a limited subset of functionality compared to the 'Create Company' API call. If you need additional features or options not present in this 'Quick Setup' API call, please use the full 'Create Company' call instead.;
member.param: Information about the company you wish to create.

member.remarks: Get multiple contact objects across all companies. A 'contact' is a person associated with a company who is designated to handle certain responsibilities of a tax collecting and filing entity. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . member.summary: Retrieve the full list of Avalara-supported entity use codes;
member.remarks: Returns the full list of Avalara-supported entity use codes. Entity/Use Codes are definitions of the entity who is purchasing something, or the purpose for which the transaction is occurring. This information is generally used to determine taxability of the product. In order to facilitate correct reporting of your taxes, you are encouraged to select the proper entity use codes for all transactions that are exempt.;

member.remarks: Returns the full list of Avalara-supported filing frequencies. This API is intended to be useful to identify all the different filing frequencies that can be used in notices.;

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ListLocationQuestionsByAddressAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Retrieve the list of questions that are required for a tax location;
member.remarks: Returns the list of additional questions you must answer when declaring a location in certain taxing jurisdictions. Some tax jurisdictions require that you register or provide additional information to configure each physical place where your company does business. This information is not usually required in order to calculate tax correctly, but is almost always required to file your tax correctly. You can call this API call for any address and obtain information about what questions must be answered in order to properly file tax in that location.;
member.param: The first line of this location's address.
The second line of this location's address.
The third line of this location's address.
The city part of this location's address.
The region, state, or province part of this location's address.
The postal code of this location's address.
The country part of this location's address.
Optionally identify the location via latitude/longitude instead of via address.
Optionally identify the location via latitude/longitude instead of via address.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ListNexusByAddressAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: List all nexus that apply to a specific address.;
member.remarks: Returns a list of all Avalara-supported taxing jurisdictions that apply to this address. This API allows you to identify which tax authorities apply to a physical location, salesperson address, or point of sale. In general, it is usually expected that a company will declare nexus in all the jurisdictions that apply to each physical address where the company does business. The results of this API call can be passed to the 'Create Nexus' API call to declare nexus for this address.;
member.param: The first address line portion of this address.
The first address line portion of this address.
The first address line portion of this address.
The city portion of this address.
The region, state, or province code portion of this address.
The postal code or zip code portion of this address.
The two-character ISO-3166 code of the country portion of this address.

member.summary: Retrieve status about a funding setup request;
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Companies that use the Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services are required to setup their funding configuration before Avalara can begin filing tax returns on their behalf. Funding configuration for each company is set up by submitting a funding setup request, which can be sent either via email or via an embedded HTML widget. When the funding configuration is submitted to Avalara, it will be reviewed by treasury team members before approval. This API checks the status on an existing funding request. This API requires a subscription to Avalara Managed Returns or SST Certified Service Provider.;

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.ActivateFundingRequestAsync(System.Int64)
member.summary: Request the javascript for a funding setup widget;
member.remarks: This API is available by invitation only. Companies that use the Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services are required to setup their funding configuration before Avalara can begin filing tax returns on their behalf. Funding configuration for each company is set up by submitting a funding setup request, which can be sent either via email or via an embedded HTML widget. When the funding configuration is submitted to Avalara, it will be reviewed by treasury team members before approval. This API returns back the actual javascript code to insert into your application to render the JavaScript funding setup widget inline. Use the 'methodReturn.javaScript' return value to insert this widget into your HTML page. This API requires a subscription to Avalara Managed Returns or SST Certified Service Provider.;
member.param: The unique ID number of this funding request

member.summary: Retrieve all nexus;
member.remarks: Get multiple nexus objects across all companies. The concept of 'Nexus' indicates a place where your company has sufficient physical presence and is obligated to collect and remit transaction-based taxes. When defining companies in AvaTax, you must declare nexus for your company in order to correctly calculate tax in all jurisdictions affected by your transactions. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.BuildPointOfSaleDataFileAsync(Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.PointOfSaleDataRequestModel)
member.summary: Point of sale data file generation;
member.remarks: Builds a point-of-sale data file containing tax rates and rules for items and locations that can be used to correctly calculate tax in the event a point-of-sale device is not able to reach AvaTax. This data file can be customized for specific partner devices and usage conditions. The result of this API is the file you requested in the format you requested using the 'responseType' field. This API builds the file on demand, and is limited to files with no more than 7500 scenarios.;
member.param: Parameters about the desired file format and report format, specifying which company, locations and TaxCodes to include.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.QuerySettingsAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve all settings;
member.remarks: Get multiple setting objects across all companies. A 'setting' is a piece of user-defined data that can be attached to a company, and it provides you the ability to store information not defined or managed by Avalara. You may create, update, and delete your own settings objects as required, and there is no mandatory data format for the 'name' and 'value' data fields. To ensure correct operation of other programs or connectors, please create a new GUID for your application and use that value for the 'set' data field. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.;

member.summary: Retrieve tax rates for a specified address;
member.remarks: Identifies estimated general tangible personal property rates for a specified address. This API produces only estimated tax rates based on assumptions and is not suitable for precise tax calculations; it should be used to identify rough guesses for tax during planning or research. For more information on estimating tax correctly, please see http://developer.avalara.com/blog/2016/11/04/estimating-tax-with-rest-v2/ .;

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.QueryTaxRulesAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve all tax rules;
member.remarks: Get multiple taxrule objects across all companies. A tax rule represents a custom taxability rule for a product or service sold by your company. If you have obtained a custom tax ruling from an auditor that changes the behavior of certain goods or services within certain taxing jurisdictions, or you have obtained special tax concessions for certain dates or locations, you may wish to create a TaxRule object to override the AvaTax engine's default behavior in those circumstances. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.;
member.param: A filter statement to identify specific records to retrieve, as defined by https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/master/Guidelines.md#97-filtering .
A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.
If nonzero, return no more than this number of results.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.
A comma separated list of sort statements in the format '(fieldname) [ASC|DESC]', for example 'id ASC'.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.GetTransactionByIdAsync(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a single transaction by ID;
member.remarks:
Get the unique transaction identified by this URL. This endpoint retrieves the exact transaction identified by this ID number even if that transaction was later adjusted by using the 'Adjust Transaction' endpoint. A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds). You may specify one or more of the following values in the '$include' parameter to fetch additional nested data, using commas to separate multiple values:
Lines
Details (implies lines)
Summary (implies details)
Addresses;
member.param: The unique ID number of the transaction to retrieve
A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.CreateTransactionAsync(Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CreateTransactionModel)
member.summary: Create a new transaction;
member.remarks: Records a new transaction in AvaTax. The 'Create Transaction' endpoint uses the configuration values specified by your company to identify the correct tax rules and rates to apply to all line items in this transaction, and reports the total tax calculated by AvaTax based on your company's configuration and the data provided in this API call. A transaction represents a unique potentially taxable action that your company has recorded, and transactions include actions like sales, purchases, inventory transfer, and returns (also called refunds).;
member.param: The transaction you wish to create

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.QueryUPCsAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve all UPCs;
member.remarks: Get multiple UPC objects across all companies. A UPC represents a single UPC code in your catalog and matches this product to the tax code identified by this UPC. Search for specific objects using the criteria in the '$filter' parameter; full documentation is available on http://developer.avalara.com/avatax/filtering-in-rest/ . Paginate your results using the '$top', '$skip', and '$orderby' parameters.;

member.name: M:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.AvaTaxClient.PingAsync
member.summary: Tests connectivity and version of the service;
member.remarks: This API helps diagnose connectivity problems between your application and AvaTax; you may call this API even if you do not have verified connection credentials. The results of this API call will help you determine whether your computer can contact AvaTax via the network, whether your authentication credentials are recognized, and the roundtrip time it takes to communicate with AvaTax.;

member.name: T:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel
member.summary: A company or business entity.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.id
member.summary: The unique ID number of this company.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.accountId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the account this company belongs to.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.parentCompanyId
member.summary: If this company is fully owned by another company, this is the unique identity of the parent company.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.sstPid
member.summary: If this company files Streamlined Sales Tax, this is the PID of this company as defined by the Streamlined Sales Tax governing board.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.companyCode
member.summary: A unique code that references this company within your account.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.name
member.summary: The name of this company, as shown to customers.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.isDefault
member.summary: This flag is true if this company is the default company for this account. Only one company may be set as the default.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.defaultLocationId
member.summary: If set, this is the unique ID number of the default location for this company.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.isActive
member.summary: This flag indicates whether tax activity can occur for this company. Set this flag to true to permit the company to process transactions.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.taxpayerIdNumber
member.summary: For United States companies, this field contains your Taxpayer Identification Number. This is a nine digit number that is usually called an EIN for an Employer Identification Number if this company is a corporation, or SSN for a Social Security Number if this company is a person. This value is required if you subscribe to Avalara Managed Returns or the SST Certified Service Provider services, but it is optional if you do not subscribe to either of those services.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.hasProfile
member.summary: Set this flag to true to give this company its own unique tax profile. If this flag is true, this company will have its own Nexus, TaxRule, TaxCode, and Item definitions. If this flag is false, this company will inherit all profile values from its parent.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.isReportingEntity
member.summary: Set this flag to true if this company must file its own tax returns. For users who have Returns enabled, this flag turns on monthly Worksheet generation for the company.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.sstEffectiveDate
member.summary: If this company participates in Streamlined Sales Tax, this is the date when the company joined the SST program.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.defaultCountry
member.summary: The two character ISO-3166 country code of the default country for this company.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.baseCurrencyCode
member.summary: This is the three character ISO-4217 currency code of the default currency used by this company.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.roundingLevelId
member.summary: Indicates whether this company prefers to round amounts at the document level or line level.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.warningsEnabled
member.summary: Set this value to true to receive warnings in API calls via SOAP.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.isTest
member.summary: Set this flag to true to indicate that this company is a test company. If you have Returns enabled, Test companies will not file tax returns and can be used for validation purposes.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.taxDependencyLevelId
member.summary: Used to apply tax detail dependency at a jurisdiction level.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.CompanyModel.inProgress
member.summary: Set this value to true to indicate that you are still working to finish configuring this company. While this value is true, no tax reporting will occur and the company will not be usable for transactions.

member.summary: The earliest date for the tax period when this return should be filed. This date specifies the earliest date for tax transactions that should be reported on this filing calendar. Please note that tax is usually filed one month in arrears: for example, tax for January transactions is typically filed during the month of February.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.FilingCalendarModel.endDate
member.summary: The last date for the tax period when this return should be filed. This date specifies the last date for tax transactions that should be reported on this filing calendar. member.summary: The code string of the tax code for this rule. When creating or updating a tax rule, you may specify either the taxCodeId value or the taxCode value.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.stateFIPS
member.summary: For U.S. tax rules, this is the state's Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code.

member.summary: The name of the jurisdiction to which this tax rule applies.

member.summary: The type of the jurisdiction to which this tax rule applies.

member.summary: The type of customer usage to which this rule applies.

member.summary: Indicates which tax types to which this rule applies.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.rateTypeId
member.summary: Indicates the rate type to which this rule applies.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.taxRuleTypeId
member.summary: This type value determines the behavior of the tax rule. You can specify that this rule controls the product's taxability or exempt / nontaxable status, the product's rate (for example, if you have been granted an official ruling for your product's rate that differs from the official rate), or other types of behavior.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.isAllJuris
member.summary: Set this value to true if this tax rule applies in all jurisdictions.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.value
member.summary: The corrected rate for this tax rule.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.threshold

member.summary: The unique ID number of the transaction to which this line item belongs.

member.summary: The line number or code indicating the line on this invoice or receipt or document.

member.summary: The unique ID number of the boundary override applied to this line item.

member.summary: The customer usage type for this line item. Usage type often affects taxability rules.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.description
member.summary: A description of the item or service represented by this line.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.destinationAddressId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the destination address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the destination address and origin address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.originAddressId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the origin address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the origin address and destination address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.discountAmount
member.summary: The amount of discount that was applied to this line item. This represents the difference between list price and sale price of the item. In general, a discount represents money that did not change hands; tax is calculated on only the amount of money that changed hands.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.discountTypeId
member.summary: The type of discount, if any, that was applied to this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.exemptAmount
member.summary: The amount of this line item that was exempt.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.exemptCertId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the exemption certificate that applied to this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.exemptNo
member.summary: If this line item was exempt, this string contains the word 'Exempt'.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.isItemTaxable
member.summary: True if this item is taxable.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.isSSTP
member.summary: True if this item is a Streamlined Sales Tax line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.itemCode
member.summary: The code string of the item represented by this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.lineAmount
member.summary: The total amount of the transaction, including both taxable and exempt. This is the total price for all items. To determine the individual item price, divide this by quantity.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.quantity
member.summary: The quantity of products sold on this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.ref1
member.summary: A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.ref2
member.summary: A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.reportingDate
member.summary: The date when this transaction should be reported. By default, all transactions are reported on the date when the actual transaction took place. In some cases, line items may be reported later due to delayed shipments or other business reasons.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.revAccount
member.summary: The revenue account number for this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.sourcing
member.summary: Indicates whether this line item was taxed according to the origin or destination.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.tax
member.summary: The amount of tax generated for this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxableAmount
member.summary: The taxable amount of this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxCalculated
member.summary: The tax calculated for this line by Avalara. If the transaction was calculated with a tax override, this amount will be different from the "tax" value.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxCode
member.summary: The code string for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxCodeId
member.summary: The unique ID number for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxDate
member.summary: The date that was used for calculating tax amounts for this line item. By default, this date should be the same as the document date. In some cases, for example when a consumer returns a product purchased previously, line items may be calculated using a tax date in the past so that the consumer can receive a refund for the correct tax amount that was charged when the item was originally purchased.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxEngine
member.summary: The tax engine identifier that was used to calculate this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxOverrideType
member.summary: If a tax override was specified, this indicates the type of tax override.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxOverrideAmount
member.summary: If a tax override was specified, this indicates the amount of tax that was requested.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxOverrideReason
member.summary: If a tax override was specified, represents the reason for the tax override.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxIncluded
member.summary: True if tax was included in the purchase price of the item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.details
member.summary: Optional: A list of tax details for this line item. To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=Details" to your URL.

member.summary: Contains a list of extra parameters that were set when the transaction was created.

member.name: T:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel
member.summary: A single transaction - for example, a sales invoice or purchase order.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.id
member.summary: The unique ID number of this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.code
member.summary: A unique customer-provided code identifying this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.companyId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the company that recorded this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.date
member.summary: The date on which this transaction occurred.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.taxDate
member.summary: The date that was used when calculating tax for this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the transaction date; however, when a consumer returns a product purchased in a previous month, it may be necessary to specify the date of the original transaction in order to correctly return the exact amount of sales tax that was charged of the consumer on the original date they purchased the product.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.paymentDate
member.summary: The date when payment was made on this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the date of the transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.status
member.summary: The status of the transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.type
member.summary: The type of the transaction. For Returns customers, a transaction type of "Invoice" will be reported to the tax authorities. A sales transaction represents a sale from the company to a customer. A purchase transaction represents a purchase made by the company. A return transaction represents a customer who decided to request a refund after purchasing a product from the company. An inventory transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.batchCode
member.summary: If this transaction was created as part of a batch, this code indicates which batch.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.currencyCode
member.summary: The three-character ISO 4217 currency code that was used for payment for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.customerUsageType
member.summary: The customer usage type for this transaction. Customer usage types often affect exemption or taxability rules.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.customerVendorCode
member.summary: CustomerVendorCode

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.exemptNo
member.summary: If this transaction was exempt, this field will contain the word "Exempt".

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.reconciled
member.summary: If this transaction has been reconciled against the company's ledger, this value is set to true.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.locationCode
member.summary: If this transaction was made from a specific reporting location, this is the code string of the location. For customers using Returns, this indicates how tax will be reported according to different locations on the tax forms.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.purchaseOrderNo
member.summary: The customer-supplied purchase order number of this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.referenceCode
member.summary: A user-defined reference code for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.salespersonCode
member.summary: The salesperson who provided this transaction. Not required.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.taxOverrideType
member.summary: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates what type of tax override was applied.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.taxOverrideAmount
member.summary: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the amount of tax that was requested by the customer.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.taxOverrideReason
member.summary: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the reason for the tax override.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalAmount
member.summary: The total amount of this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalExempt
member.summary: The amount of this transaction that was exempt.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalTax
member.summary: The total tax calculated for all lines in this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalTaxable
member.summary: The portion of the total amount of this transaction that was taxable.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalTaxCalculated
member.summary: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the amount of tax Avalara calculated for the transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.adjustmentReason
member.summary: If this transaction was adjusted, indicates the unique ID number of the reason why the transaction was adjusted.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.adjustmentDescription
member.summary: If this transaction was adjusted, indicates a description of the reason why the transaction was adjusted.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.locked
member.summary: If this transaction has been reported to a tax authority, this transaction is considered locked and may not be adjusted after reporting.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.region
member.summary: The two-or-three character ISO region code of the region for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.country
member.summary: The two-character ISO 3166 code of the country for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.version
member.summary: If this transaction was adjusted, this indicates the version number of this transaction. Incremented each time the transaction is adjusted.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.softwareVersion
member.summary: The software version used to calculate this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.originAddressId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the origin address for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.destinationAddressId

member.summary: If this transaction included foreign currency exchange, this is the date as of which the exchange rate was calculated.
